You can contact us at info@Angootha pe.com or by Our registered office address is 14 Charles Walk, Rowley Regis, England, B65 9ED and head office is at Angootha pe Ltd, Office 513, 5th Floor, Quayside Tower, Broad Street, Birmingham B1 2HF You means the user of the website operated by Angootha pe. This website (www.Angootha pe.com) is operated and owned by Angootha pe with company registration number is; 10338529 (hereafter referred to as Angootha pe).mailing us by post. The use and access to the Angootha pe Websiteis provided on the basis of the following terms and conditions:
1. Changes to the Website 1.1 Angootha pe may from time to time make such changes to the content of the Website or the products and services it offers. 1.2 Angootha pe may withdraw such services and products as considered appropriate. 1.3 Angootha pe may terminate your access or use of the Website if there is any breach of our terms or conditions or in the case of breach of law orregulation . Angootha pe reserves the right to use various procedures to authenticate each transaction including identity checks. Angootha pe reserves the right to decline or to discontinue processing any part of your order at any time. 1.4 Angootha pe may discontinue the operation of the Website.
2. Permitted access to the Website 2.1 You should not use the Website from any country where accessing or using the Website or any of the information, products or services on it is prohibited by law. This Website does not constituteany invitation or solicitation by Angootha pe to any person to use any such information, products or services in countries where to do so is prohibited by law.
3. Reliance on Information posted 3.1 Angootha pe shall use its reasonableendeavours to ensure that any dated information contained or reproduced on the Website is up to date at the stated date of its publication. Angootha pe does not accept any responsibility to update or amend any information. The information or content provided by the Website may be out of date at any given time.
4. Restrictions on the use of the Website 4.1 The content of the Website and the products and services made available by Angootha pe on the Website are intended for use by holiday or businesstravellers or by individuals or corporations seeking to purchase currencies for the purpose of business or travel, and should not be used for speculation or investment.
5. Intellectual Property 5.1 All intellectual property and all materials comprising or contained in the Website but not limited to all text/articles, logos, softwareand images, are owned, or licensed, except as otherwise expressly stated, by Angootha pe. 5.2 You are entitled to access the Website for the purposes of accessing the facilities offered by Angootha pe. However you may not use the Website or its contents in any way, directly or indirectly, for any other purpose. The materials on the Website may not be copied or redistributed for commercial purpose or for compensation of any kind without written permission from Angootha pe.
6. Links to other websites 6.1 This Website contains links to third party websites. Such links are provided for your convenience. 6.2 Angootha pe has no control over publications by third party websites. Angootha pe does not warrant the content or accuracy of such third party websites nor does Angootha pe accept responsibility or liability in relation to the content or products offered by thesites .
7. Limitations On Liability 7.1 All content shown on the Website including the services and products we provide are made available without any warranties, conditions or guarantees given by Angootha pe. All such warranties, conditions or guarantees which would otherwise be implied by law are excluded to the fullest extent permitted by law. In particular, Angootha pe does not warrant the accuracy, suitability, reliability, completeness, performance and/or fitness for purpose of the content of any services or products available on this Website. 7.2 Angootha pe uses reasonable skill and care in providing its products and services to you. However (to the maximum extent permitted by law) Angootha pe is not liable to you for any loss, damage, claim or compensation (including loss of profit or loss of use) arising out of: 7.2.1 your use, delay or inability to use this Website; 7.2.2 any inability to perform any of Angootha pe\'s obligations due tofailure of any technical or computer systems; 7.2.3 any reasons beyond Angootha pe\'s reasonable control. This will include (amongst other things) war, terrorism, government action, natural disaster, and industrial disputes; 7.2.4 any damage to your computer equipment as a result of using this Website or any products or services provided from it; 7.2.5 any change in foreign currency rates which may occur from time to time. 7.3 Without limiting the more general exclusions of liability as set out in sections 7.1 and 7.2, (to the maximum extent permitted by law) Angootha pe is not liable to you for any loss of profit, loss of use, indirect, or consequential losses, claims or other damages suffered or incurred by you from the use of the Website or products or services itofferes. 7.4 Angootha pe\'s maximum aggregate liability to you in respect of all foreign currency transactions undertaken by you shall be limited to a refund equivalent to anymoneys you have paid to Angootha pe to acquire foreign currency. 7.5 Angootha pe does not warrant that the Website is free of viruses or of other material which is malicious or technologically harmful. Angootha pe is not liable for any viruses for other technologically harmful material that may affect your computer equipment, computer programs or other material resulting from your use of the Website. 7.6 The disclaimers and limitations of liability in these terms and conditions shall not apply to any damages arising from death or personal injury caused by the negligence of Angootha pe or any of its employees or agents or for fraud. 7.7 Angootha pe does not accept any liability for loss occasioned by fraudulent spending or any other unauthorized use of the service but will assist its customers in preparing a claim for submission to the appropriate third partieswhere requested to do so. 7.8 If any provisions of these terms and conditions including these disclaimers and limitations shall be unlawful or unenforceable then such provisions shall fall away and shall not affect the validity and enforceability of the remaining terms. Your statutory rights remain unaffected.
8. Privacy And Data Protection Angootha pe processes information about you in accordance with its privacy policy. By using the website you consent to such processes and confirm that all data you provide is accurate. Governing Laws and Changes to These Terms and Conditions
9. Use of Website The use of the Website and these terms and conditionsis governed by the Laws of England and Wales.
10. Disputes All Disputes arising out of the use of the Website and/or any services or products provided by Angootha pe or any dispute relating to these terms and conditions shall be resolved by the courts Of England And Wales.
11. Right to change Angootha pe reserves the right to change these terms and conditions from time to time. You should check these terms and conditions every time you use the Website. By using the Website you will be treated as having consented to these terms and conditions and/or any revised terms and conditions which may appear from time to time.
Provisions Relating To Placing Of The Order And When The Contract Between You And Top Connect Is Formed. 1. Orders through the Website must only be placed by individuals over the age of 18. 2. On the Website Angootha pe makes available currency for purchase in respect of holiday and business travel etc., (but not for investment or speculation). 3. Please follow the steps on the screen in order to place an order. Angootha pe reserves the right to request further information in order to process your order. 4. Angootha pe will use various procedures to authenticate each transaction for the purposes of law and regulations including anti-money laundering regulations. Angootha pe reserves the right to decline or process any part of your order at any time. 5. You will be able to edit the details of your order any time up until you press the Book Now button. 6. Angootha pe will send you an email acknowledgement of your order once it has received it but please note that this is an acknowledgement only and does not mean acceptance of your order by Angootha pe. 7. Once you have placed your order for money transfer on our Website or via phone or via visiting our office or branch, you authorise Top Connect tOnce you have placed your order for money transfer on our Website or via phone or via visiting our office or branch, you authorise Angootha pe to action your order and hence you will not be allowed to cancel the orderit subject to the cancellation policy set out in paragraph 8 below. Should you wish to make any amendments to your order, Angootha pe will use its reasonable endeavors to accommodate your needs but the final decision is down to our sole discretion. If you wish to amend your order please send an e-mail to our manager at info@Angootha pe.com. Any such amendments will be subject to the applicable foreign exchange rates as published on the Website by Angootha pe from time to time. If Angootha pe agrees to amend you order you will receive an e-mail to confirm this. However Angootha pe is under no obligation to accept any such amendments to your order and Angootha pe accepts no liability or responsibility in the event that it decides not to do so. 8. You may cancel your order by providing Angootha pe with written notice of cancellation, by email to info@Angootha pe.com at the earliest opportunity. Please note that by this time, Angootha pe may have purchased your Cedi order at the foreign exchange rate of that day. In the case of cancellation you will receive a refund at the foreign exchange rate prevailing at the time of cancellation of the order which may be different to the foreign exchange rate at the time of your order as the Cedi, GBP and US dollar exchange rates fluctuate. 9. All orders are subject to acceptance by Angootha pe and Angootha pe will confirm such acceptance by email indicating that your order has been accepted. The contract between Angootha pe and you will only be formed once Angootha pe sends you the confirmation email that your order has been accepted. Until that time there will be no binding arrangement for Angootha pe to supply you with any money transfer service, foreign exchange or other services. You should print and retain a copy of the confirmation email for your records or the receipt slip that will be provided to you by Angootha pe. 10. Angootha pe is not obliged to accept any order and may decline to do so for any reason Price, Availability And Delivery 11. Your money transfer request will be delivered at the time of your instruction. 12. The GBP price payable for Cedi that you wish to send will be as shown on the confirmation screen and will be only valid for a short period of time as Foreign exchange rates fluctuates regularly . If you do not submit your order immediately you enter the confirmation screen the price many change and you will need to enter the screen again to see the updated price. 13. Angootha pe have the right to revise and amend these terms and conditions from time to time. You will be subject to the terms and conditions in force at the time you place your order with Angootha pe. By placing an order you agree to the terms and conditions in force at the time the order is made. 14. Angootha pe is entitled to refuse, withdraw or cancel your money transfer order at anytime, for any reason. Angootha pe may terminate any money transfer order at any time. 15. Please be advised that certain requests may be beyond Angootha pe\'s control. As such, Angootha pe accepts no liability for such actions. If you pay by card, please note that Angootha pe does not refund charges made by your card issuer and that the late cancellation fee may also be subject to a cash advance fee from your card issuer.
Angootha pe May Also Terminate Any Contract It Has With You If It Is Required To Do So On Instructions Of Any Law Enforcement Agency Or Regulatory Body. In This Case Angootha pe May Retain All Or Any Of Your Money If It Is Required To Do So By Law And Then Deal With It As Ordered By A Court Or Other Body Of Competent Jurisdiction.
As a Money Services Business (MSB), Angootha pe is registered and regulated by HM Customs Excise under Money Laundering Regulations and licensed by the FCA as a PaymentInstitution..
Our staff are fully conversant with Anti-Money Laundering guidelines and are aware of their responsibilities in the monitoring and reporting of any actions that raise suspicion or give cause for concern.
Angootha pe reserves the right to perform identity checks in accordance with the terms and conditions on all individuals who place an order on the website. For further information on these identity checks please contact info@Angootha pe.com.
Angootha pe reserves the right at all times to refuse to process any foreign currency order which it believes in its sole discretion, is connected in any manner of unlawful or illegal purpose. We have a legal obligation to report to Customs and Excise or NCIS any such suspicious transactions. Angootha pe is obliged by law to monitor any unusual or suspicious transactions of any size taking place when we have reasons to believe the money is being derived from unlawful or illegal activity.
There is a statutory obligation on all Angootha pe employees and their agents to report suspicious transactions to the UK authorities. Where any such report is made, Angootha pe accepts no liability for any delay in transmission of or confiscation of the funds. The Rates are subject to change in accordance with current national rates. Please enquire to get more details

Welcome to the Angootha pe Ltd website (hereinafter referred to as Angootha pe) www.Angootha pe.com. Protecting your privacy is very important to us. Therefore the purpose of this Policy is to inform our customers and other individuals (you or your) how we deal with, collect, use, disclose and protect your personal information. This Policy applies to our collection of, use of and disclosure of, personal information in the United Kingdom. This Policy does not apply to information about our employees or to information that is not personal information. You can be assured that Angootha pealwaystake steps to comply with the privacy principles and requirements under applicable UK privacy legislation. This policy is applicable to all Angootha pe consumers and visitors who visit our website. www.Angootha pe.com Personal Information The personal information that we collect is information about an identifiable individual, as described under applicable privacy legislation. Angootha pe collects personal information about you from a variety of sources in the course of providing you with money transfer service and other related products and services, which include the following: We collect personal information when you ask us to send money or to provide other any other Service to you. This personal information may include identities and contact information of senders and recipients of money transfers or payments, credit card, banking or other billing information, birth dates and other personal identifiers such as Passport details, Driving License or other such governmental identification. Information is used to verify your identity for security and fraud prevention purposes, identification numbers and amounts paid, transferred, exchanged or otherwise processed. We collect information about your transactions with us, including transaction history, such as frequency of use and amounts paid, transferred, exchanged or otherwise processed and any rewards program account information, if any. verification, fraud prevention In and similar security purposes, we collect and/or confirm certain identity-related information, financial background and similar information through third parties sources such as government agencies and consumer reporting agencies. We may collect personal information otherwise with your consent or as permitted or required by law.connectionwithidentify
Use of Personal Information We generally use personal information for the purposes of providing you the Service. This may include the following purposes: Authorising and processing your transactions, including effecting and administering money transfers, and ensuring proper payment to the designated recipient of funds. Collecting amounts owing to us, and otherwise enforcing and collecting on your accounts or agreements with us. Meeting legal, regulatory, self-regulatory, risk management, fraud prevention and security requirements, which may include (among other measures) verifying the identity of the customer and receiver of funds and checking identities against money laundering, terrorist financing or similar watch lists established by regulatory agencies or similar bodies in the UK or in other countries. For identity verification purposes, customers and receiver of money transfers may be required to produce valid identification or consent to verification by other means. Maintaining business and transaction records for reasonable periods, and generally managing and administering our business. Meeting insurance, audit and processing requirements. Otherwise, as permitted or required by law. There may be circumstances in which Angootha pe is obliged to collect, use, or disclose certain personal information without your consent. Such circumstances include: A serious and imminent threat to someoneâ€™s life, health or safety. A serious threat to public health or public safety. Unlawful activity has been, is being or may be engaged in. If Angootha pe reasonably believes that the use or disclosure is necessary for the prevention, detection , investigation, prosecution or punishment of: Criminal offences, breach of law, imposing of penalty or sanction or breach of a prescribed law. the enforcement of laws relating to the confiscation of the proceeds of crime. the protection of the public revenue; the prevention, detection, investigation or remedying of seriously improper conduct or prescribed conduct; or the preparation for, or conduct of, proceedings before any Court or Tribunal, or implementation of the orders of a Court or Tribunal. If Angootha pe is obliged to use or disclose your personal information as herein mentioned, it will create a written report of the use or disclosure. We store information that we collect through cookies, log files, and/or third parties to create a profile of our users. Consequently, collected information is used to improve the content of the site for the user. If we make changes to any of our Privacy Policies or practices with respect to how we use personally identifiable information, we will post those changes with or without notice to this Privacy Policy as and when they come into effect. In some cases we may be required to disclose certain information to comply with a legal process, such as a court order, subpoena or search warrant.
Disclosure of Your Personal Information We may disclose your personal information to our affiliate partners and to unaffiliated third parties in connection with the purposes described in this Privacy Policy as follows: To Provide Services: In order to process and complete the requested Service, we may disclose personal information to the recipient of a money transfer, to our agents or affiliates, and, if applicable, the recipient and any intermediary banks or other financial institutions or financial services companies involved in the transaction or our Service. Service Providers: We may transfer personal information to outside agents or service providers (including our affiliate partners acting in this capacity) that perform services on our behalf, for example, information technology and/or data hosting or processing services. Some of these service providers or affiliate partners may be located outside the United Kingdom, and your personal information may be collected, used, disclosed, stored and processed in the United Kingdom or elsewhere for the purposes described in this Privacy Policy. We take reasonable measures to ensure that personal information that may be processed by these service providers on our behalf is protected and not used or disclosed for purposes other than as directed by us, subject to legal requirements in the UK and other foreign countries applicable to our affiliates, agents and service providers, for example lawful requirements to disclose personal information to government authorities in those countries. Business Transactions: Your personal information may be used by us and disclosed to parties connected with the contemplated or actual financing, securitisation, insuring, sale, assignment or other disposal of all or part of our business or assets (including, for example, your account with us), for purposes related to the evaluation and performance of these transactions, including: permitting such parties to evaluate and determine whether to proceed or continue with the transaction, and fulfilling reporting, inspection or audit requirements or obligations to such parties. Our successors and assignees and/or its business or assets may use and disclose your personal information for similar purposes as described in this Privacy Policy. Legal, Regulatory, etc: Angootha pe may disclose your personal information as necessary to meet legal, regulatory, self-regulatory, insurance, audit, and security requirements, and as otherwise with your consent or as permitted or required by law (including as required by applicable UK and foreign laws).
UK Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) require all financial institutions including Angootha pe to verify but not limited to the identity of the customer, purpose of transaction and source of funds. To comply with these regulatory requirements, we will be comparing, which also include sharing the information that you have provided such as but not limited to Name, Address, Driver\'s license number and any other information contained in your consumer report, with available and reputable ID verification service provider. Such agency will only use the information in your consumer report for the purpose of validating your identity and no other.
If we are unable to validate your identity through the on-line process, you will be directed to an alternative, off-line process. Additional documentary proof might be required for establishing the source of funds. Our services have also been regulated by the HMRC and comply with money laundering regulations.
Your Consent Consent to the collection,useand disclosure of personal information may be given in various ways. Consent can be express (for example, orally, electronically or on a form you may sign describing the intended uses and disclosures of personal information) or implied (for example, when you provide information necessary for a service you have requested).
You may provide your consent in some circumstances where notice has been provided to you about our intentions with respect to your personal information and you have not withdrawn your consent for an identified purpose, such as by using an opt out option provided, if any. Consent may be given by your authorized representative (such as a legal guardian or a person having a power of attorney). Generally, by providing us with personal information, we will assume that you consent to our collection, use and disclosure of such information for the purposes identified or described in this Privacy Policy, if applicable, or otherwise at the time of collection.
You may withdraw your consent to our collection, use and disclosure of personal information at any time, subject to contractual and legal restrictions and reasonable notice. Note that if you withdraw your consent to uses of your personal information, we may no longer be able to provide certain Services. Note also that where we have provided or are providing services to you, your consent will be valid for so long as necessary to fulfill the purposes described in this Privacy Policy or otherwise at the time of collection, and you may not be permitted to withdraw consent to certain necessary uses and disclosures (for example, but not limited to, maintaining reasonable business and transaction records and disclosures to UK and foreign government entities as required to comply with laws). Angootha pe collects, uses and discloses your personal information with your consent, except as permitted or required by law. We may be required or permitted under state laws, federal laws, or foreign statute or regulation to collect, use or disclose personal information without your consent, for example to comply with a court order, to comply with local or federal regulations or a legally permitted inquiry by a government agency, or to collect a debt owed to us.
Security Angootha pe takes all reasonable steps to protect your personal information using physical, electronic or procedural security measures appropriate to the sensitivity of the information in our custody or control, which may include safeguards to protect against loss or theft, as well as unauthorised access, disclosure, copying, use or modification. Our authorised employees, agents and subsidiaries who require access to your personal information in order to fulfill their job requirements will have access to your personal information.
We have in place a range of security safeguards to protect your personal information against loss or theft, as well as unauthorized access, disclosure, copying, use, or modification, regardless of the format in which it is held.
Angootha pe work to protect personally identifiable information stored on their siteâ€™s server from unauthorised access using commercially available and industrially acceptable standards of computer security products, such as firewalls, as well as carefully developed security procedures and practices. In addition, a username and password are generally required for you to use, view or change application or interview information. We use both internal and external resources to review the adequacy of security measures on a regular basis.
Angootha pe ensures that all staff are aware of the importance of maintaining the confidentiality of personal information.
Access, Correction and Contacting Us Angootha pe will upon request allow you to access to your personal information. The requested information shall be provided or made available in a form that is generally understandable. In circumstances where you point out to us that any information held by us is inaccurate or incomplete, we will take appropriate action to amend the information as required and, if necessary, notify any third party of the correction. There may be circumstances which preclude Angootha pe from providing access to some or all of your personal information. Those circumstances could be: The information may contain references to other individuals; Legal, investigative, security, or commercial proprietary reasons; or The information is subject to solicitor/client or litigation privilege.
This Privacy Policy Though we make every effort to preserve user privacy, we may need to disclose personal information when required by law wherein we have a good-faith belief that such action is necessary to comply with a current judicial proceeding, a court order or legal process served on our websites. Legal Disclaimer
This Privacy Policy may be revised from time to time. If we intend to use or disclose Personal Information for purposes materially different than those described in this Policy, we will make reasonable efforts to notify affected individuals, if necessary, including by revising this Privacy Policy. If you are concerned about how your personal information is used, you should contact us as described above to obtain a current copy of this Privacy Policy. We urge you to request and review this Privacy Policy frequently to obtain the current version. Your continued provision of personal information or use of our services following any changes to this Privacy Policy constitutes your acceptance of any such changes. Privacy Policy Changes
or telephone us at +44 - 7508084715. If you wish to make inquiries or complaints or have other concerns about our personal information practices, you may write to us as described above, e-mail us at lastmodified April 25, 2018.info@Angootha pe.com

What are considered as valid ID documents?

"Angootha pe customers can enjoy worldwide money transfers with a Â£5 transfer fee. Generally, banks will charge Â£15 - Â£30 no matter the amount being sent. Fees aside, our customers will make further savings through the very competitive exchange rates that we use."
"Angootha pe has a growing number of countries to which you can transfer money and exchange currencies. Please refer to the drop-down list on the site."
"This depends on a number of factors, like, where the funds are sent from, where the funds are going, and in which currency you are sending them etc. However, generally, this process is very fast."

It\'s really simple: Register with Angootha pe Login to your account and get a live exchange rate quote Enter the recipient bank account details to book your money transfer Send us the funds, relax and we\'ll deliver the funds to your nominated bank account as quickly as possible.

High street banks may have been around a lot longer than specialist currency brokers like Angootha pe, but they remain uncompetitive when it comes to helping people transfer money internationally. Not just uncompetitive with their exchange rates and high fees, but also with their levels of customer service and specialist foreign exchange knowledge. Better exchange rates than any bank Â£5 transfer fee (Max) 24/7 access to our experts Speedy currency transfers Regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority Different types of transfers available
Use Angootha pe when: Emigrating or moving overseas. Buying or selling property abroad Making overseas purchase Investing overseas Sending money to family and friends Making regular payments abroad"
This is normally a maximum of 24 hours, however, this does depend on the country and mode of payment. You can contact us for advice regarding your sending options and destinations.

Angootha pe money transfer has its own branches as well as a wide network of agents all over the UK. If you wish to find an agent or are interested in becoming an agent, we would be happy to hear from you. Please contact us.
You can contact us via phone, fax or email and we will find the closest agent to you.
Unfortunately, there is. The cash limit for money transfer in a day is Â£5000. An ID will be required when Â£3000 and above is being transferred.
Incorrect information may cause delays in the payment. Please contact us in such instances and correct the information that you have provided as soon as possible.
Yes, you can transfer money with our agencies in the same country.
To cancel a money transfer or request a refund, kindly contact us. Please note that we will be unable to carry out a refund if the transaction has been paid.

As proof of identification, you can use a passport or your country of residence\'s official identity document. For the use of other types of documents, please contact us for verification. Documents must be valid within the expiration date"
